review: First off lets start with the pros of this device:1. ASAP cache is pretty awesome, Prime content starts pretty much instantly.2. The size is perfect, no silly contours or shapes, it also has wired Ethernet which is a huge plus.3. The remote is comfortable and easy to use4. Voice search works great.5. Very powerful box, runs games pretty smoothly.6. Works with other (potentially cheaper) game pads, not just the Amazon FireTV Game padNow the Cons:1. If you don't have an Amazon Prime account don't get this box, you're better off getting a Roku2. No way to turn off the suggestions and videos that are not included in your Prime streaming account. I understand why this is (revenue generating) but at least make it a setting that's buried deep somewhere because it's pretty annoying and really uglies up the interface (try to browse through the Daily Show or Colbert Report videos for example).3. If you subscribe to Netflix you won't benefit from the ASAP cache which is a bummer, but not a deal breaker.4. The voice search ONLY works on videos in Amazon's Prime catalog, it will not search Netflix or other providers.5. If you've purchased a game on Android marketplace you'll need to re-purchase it here (even though on the back end this thing is running Android).If Amazon fixes these cons in an update package this player would be perfect.
